Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw the following lines to create a loop: 1. Line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.085, 0.0] 2. Line from point [0.085, 0.0] to point [0.085, 0.2902] 3. Line from point [0.085, 0.2902] to point [0.6653, 0.2902] 4. Line from point [0.6653, 0.2902] to point [0.6653, 0.0] 5. Line from point [0.6653, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0] 6. Line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.029] 7. Line from point [0.75, 0.029] to point [0.6943, 0.029] 8. Line from point [0.6943, 0.029] to point [0.6943, 0.3192] 9. Line from point [0.6943, 0.3192] to point [0.056, 0.3192] 10. Line from point [0.056, 0.3192] to point [0.056, 0.029] 11. Line from point [0.056, 0.029] to point [0.0, 0.029] 12. Line from point [0.0, 0.029] to point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined for the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0725 units towards the positive normal direction to create a 3D model. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0218, 0.7077, 0.029]. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with a center at point [0.0145, 0.0145] and a radius of 0.0145. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1813 units towards the negative normal direction to create a 3D model. Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0218, 0.0135, 0.029]. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with a center at point [0.0145, 0.0145] and a radius of 0.0145. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1813 units towards the negative normal direction to create a 3D model.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** at the following location: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, -0.197, 0.0313] 2. **Draw 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Create a rectangle** by drawing lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the Euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the Z-axis by 0.0313 units to create a 3D model. Part 2: Cylindrical Object Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has a smooth surface and appears to be a solid, three-dimensional shape. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** at the following location: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2656, 0.0686, 0.0625] 2. **Draw 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Create a circle** by defining the center and radius: - Center: [0.1094, 0.1094] - Radius: 0.1094 4. **Extrude the circle along the Z-axis** by -0.25 units to create a 3D model. The negative extrusion value creates a tapered effect, with the top of the cylinder being thinner than the base. 5. **Cut the cylindrical object from the first prism part** with the second part to create a cylindrical hole in the center of the prism.</description>
